image.altText: An entrance to the Westfield Marion Shopping Centre.

props.synopsis: A teenage boy who allegedly wielded a machete during a brawl that sent the Westfield Marion shopping centre into lockdown last month has been granted home detention bail.

title.children: Teen involved in Adelaide shopping centre fight given home detention bail

image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: South Australia's public health department suspends 10 staff over allegations they "inappropriately" accessed the medical records of a patient ABC News understands to be the SA police commissioner's son.

title.children: SA Health staff allegedly accessed records of police commissioner's son after crash

props.synopsis: Just hours after walking away from Labor and taking her place on the crossbench, Fatima Payman reveals what led her to quit. Follow live.

title.children: Fatima Payman speaks to the ABC after walking away from Labor

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Payman clarifies earlier statement, says meeting at The Lodge was not intimidating
Does Payman intend to form her own party?
Labor acted 'with restraint' when dealing with Fatima Payman: Marles

image.altText: A woman holds up a specially designed 50 cent coin

props.synopsis: A young Indigenous artist will have her work circulated in wallets around the country to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the National Aboriginal and Islanders Day Observance Committee.

title.children: Artist shares her surprise after her design is picked for new NAIDOC collectible coin

image.altText: A drone hovers in the sky above Darwin.

props.synopsis: A Mount Gambier man incarcerated for drug trafficking has been fined $6,500 for flying a drone near people and at night in one of the largest penalties for an unmanned aircraft.

title.children: Drug trafficker fined thousands of dollars for flying drone over city

image.altText: A lake which has iced over. The sun shines brightly overhead.

props.synopsis: The abnormal pressure is having a significant impact on the nation's weather, including extreme low overnight temperatures over south-east states and a lengthy stretch of showery days along the eastern seaboard.

title.children: Australia's highest air pressure on record observed as monster high engulfs the nation

image.altText: A graphic showing a St Vincent's hospital and nib logos side by side, separated by ripped paper

props.synopsis: St Vincent's is planning to end its contract with private health insurer nib after negotiations for renewal broke down.

title.children: 'First time in 167 years': Hospital chain flags shock split from major health insurer

image.altText: A group of football players wearing purple jumpers huddle together.

props.synopsis: A study finds local sporting clubs are taking steps to improve their members' mental health, but some need support to implement "best practice" initiatives.

title.children: Sporting clubs want to support players' mental health, but some aren't sure how

image.altText: bruce lehrmann walking outside court

props.synopsis: The 29-year-old faces two counts of rape, alleged to have occurred in Toowoomba, west of Brisbane, in October 2021.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann committed to stand trial on two counts of rape

image.altText: Senator Fatima Payman stands in front of a media pack in Parliament House to announce she's quitting the Labor Party

props.synopsis: First-term senator Fatima Payman has quit Labor to sit on the crossbench, after becoming the first Labor MP in decades to defy her party in a vote to recognise Palestinian statehood.

title.children: Fatima Payman quits Labor, accuses colleagues of intimidation

image.altText: Fatima Payman sits on the crossbench in the Senate

props.synopsis: Senator Fatima Payman was once held up by colleagues the modern face of both Australia and the party she represented. Today, she joined the crossbench.

title.children: Fatima Payman was once hailed as the modern face of the Labor party. Today she joined the crossbench

image.altText: Gorgeous photo of sea lion pup resting on its mum, both asleep on a rock above the ocean

props.synopsis: A national research effort aimed at saving Australia's iconic sea lions will look at cat faeces, heavy metals, microplastics, and climate change as possible culprits for the species' continued decline.

title.children: They're top-tier marine predators, so why are our endangered sea lions in a fight for survival?

image.altText: A slightly smiling older Caucasian man, wears a cap, sunnies, holds a black show chicken, wire shed behind.

props.synopsis: Avian influenza is causing chaos for poultry fanciers interstate, and now South Australian agricultural shows are barring interstate entrants or cancelling events to keep the disease out.

title.children: Bird flu spread 'a real concern' for poultry fanciers as SA shows cancelled

image.altText: A woman holds a document as walks on pavement past signs saying "polling station".

props.synopsis: Voting in the UK's general election begins today as a media blackout descends across the country and silences its political hopefuls.

title.children: Voting is set to open in the UK election. This is why we can't really tell you about it

image.altText: A streak of light across the night sky over a busy street.

props.synopsis: Multiple unrelated fireballs were detected over Victoria last night. Experts say the back-to-back sightings were a "bit of a fluke".

title.children: Did you see a series of mysterious fireballs fly through Melbourne's sky overnight? Astronomers say the sightings were 'unusual'

image.altText: A young woman wearing grey dress over black skivvy stands in front of a house, smiling with a mug in her hands

props.synopsis: Australian homes are notoriously cold in winter — draughty, with poor insulation, thin glass and inadequate heating. But there's a growing movement of people retrofitting their homes to make them cheaper to run and more comfortable year-round, while also reducing emissions.

title.children: Got an old, cold house like Laine's? Here are seven ways to make it warmer and cheaper

image.altText: A man leans to work on a large server, standing in an aisle of servers with cables running everywhere.

props.synopsis: American technology giant Amazon will establish a "top-secret" data cloud to store classified Australian military and intelligence information under a partnership with the federal government.

title.children: Amazon wins $2b contract to store 'top-secret' Australian military intelligence

image.altText: A wide brown river and farms

props.synopsis: The federal government will go to tender next month seeking the rights to up to 70 gigalitres of water from farmers in the southern Murray-Darling Basin, through the first major water entitlements buyback program since new laws were introduced last year.

title.children: Government opens up chequebook to offer water buybacks for Murray-Darling Basin farmers

image.altText: Joe Biden yells mouth wide open with his fist in the air at a podium.

props.synopsis: This past week was arguably the worst of Joe Biden's 2024 campaign. And it might have been one of Donald Trump's best.

title.children: Biden's bad night has become a worse week. And for Trump, things keep getting better

image.altText: Amir Maimon looks down on the Press Club stage.

props.synopsis: Israeli ambassador Amir Maimon is reportedly summoned to a meeting in Canberra and warned his nation could not expect Australia's support if it goes to war with listed terror group Hezbollah in Lebanon.

title.children: Birmingham says government must explain Israeli ambassador call-in

image.altText: Two teenage boys sit on the couch, using mobile phones.

props.synopsis: Female teachers are being sworn at, sexually harassed and physically threatened in high schools by male students. They say young men are bringing the misogynistic ideas of Andrew Tate and other online influencers into the classroom.

title.children: 'Disgusting and disturbing': Why some female teachers are leaving the profession

image.altText: A swampy shallow creek with trees around.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have found human remains belonging to a missing 12-year-old girl who is suspected to have been taken by a crocodile in a remote NT creek.

title.children: Human remains found of 12-year-old girl reportedly taken by crocodile in remote NT creek

image.altText: A woman stands with three people in front of a helicopter - two are in police and paramedic uniforms.

props.synopsis: As Bron stood atop a ridge, trying to find her way back to the Larapinta Trail, all she could think about was the Victorian hiker whose body was retrieved from the same track only a month before.

title.children: Hiker with only half a cup of water rescued from remote track where man was found dead a month ago

image.altText: Robbie Awad of Sydney has appeared in Proserpine Magistrates Court on charges relating to his wife's death.

props.synopsis: Robbie Awad had been married to Marina Hanna for just 10 days when the buggy he was driving on Hamilton Island tipped and killed his bride.

title.children: Husband's trial begins over fatal golf buggy rollover that killed wife on their honeymoon

image.altText: Tasmania Police officer wearing high-vis vest.

props.synopsis: A senior Tasmanian police officer who was under investigation for child sexual abuse offences when he died by suicide was still sending explicit messages to teens in the days leading up to his death, a report finds.

title.children: 'Truly shocking and horrific': Officer given full police funeral groomed more than 50 boys and young men, report finds

image.altText: Michael Ross Tyler in a selfie with a cowboy hat on

props.synopsis: A man who bought a 3D printer to help his autistic son with school work has been granted bail after spending nine months in jail on weapons manufacture charges.

title.children: Dad who tried to make guns with son's 3D printer really regrets 'foolish act'

image.altText: Derelict terrace houses covered in graffiti.

props.synopsis: With official estimates putting the number of vacant and derelict homes above 100,000 across Australia, local governments and property lawyers argue they could be part of the solution to Australia's apparent housing shortage.

title.children: These houses in Sydney have sat empty for decades, but there's 'very little' council can do about it

image.altText: A young woman in a multicoloured jumper looks off camera

props.synopsis: Sue Powell, a nurse who cared for the teenager and her newborn baby, told the court she was concerned something might happen "at the hands of Robert Geeves" after learning details about his history with police.

title.children: Nurse who cared for missing teen Amber Haigh was 'alarmed' by accused killer's past

image.altText: A number of beauty products placed on a vibrant pink display stand.

props.synopsis: Australian cosmetics giant MCoBeauty has attracted global attention for its strikingly similar beauty dupes, but the company has kept the details of its product development process out of the spotlight — until now.

title.children: We asked MCoBeauty to explain how they dupe cosmetics. They gave us a step-by-step guide

image.altText: An aerial shot shows a large complex of buildings with red roofs, including a palace, with a bay in the background.

props.synopsis: China has handed over a massive newly-built presidential palace to Vanuatu days before the Pacific nation's prime minister is expected to visit Beijing.

title.children: China has added a sprawling new palace to the skyline of Vanuatu's capital — but some fear it will be hard to maintain

image.altText: Collingwood walk off the field after AFL loss to Gold Coast.

props.synopsis: Essendon vice-captain Andrew McGrath expects to face Collingwood at its best, as the rivals meet for the first time since their Anzac Day classic.

title.children: Have the Magpies lost their 'aura'? The Bombers have their say

image.altText: Donnell Wallam

props.synopsis: Donnell Wallam has had to endure more scrutiny in her four years at the top than most players deal with in their entire careers, and on the eve of First Nations Round an old coach has questioned why her Super Netball club didn't protect her from seeing an offensive fan letter.

title.children: 'It would have destroyed anyone else': Netball condemns racist mail sent to Donnell Wallam

image.altText: A woman lies in bed with striped blue covers pulled up to her eyes. She looks to the side with a playful expression.

props.synopsis: While the stereotype of men always wanting sex and women doing what they can to avoid it might ring true for some, there are women who feel ruled by sexual desire.

title.children: Veronica thinks about sex all the time – and that has consequences

image.altText: A man standing on a balcony deck, looking over a swimming pool with large arid mountains and a blue sky beyond the propety

props.synopsis: Igal uses the online platform Booking.com to advertise his holiday apartment. But human rights lawyers want the practice banned and allege Booking.com is breaking international law.

title.children: It's a home with a serious view. But human rights lawyers say Booking.com should be banned from advertising it

image.altText: two orcas pop out of the water with cliffs in the background

props.synopsis: With distinctive characteristics, Split Fin and Bent Tip are part of an orca family that has thrilled South Coast residents since being spotted more than 20 years ago.

title.children: Famous orca Split Fin excites South Coast residents by returning with new family member
